reviewText: I was very happy with this purchase because I was looking for something pretty in-depth. It's for people like me who already have a basic knowledge of the work, but want to widen the scope to include musicological, political, theatrical, and aesthetic analyses. The footage of conductor Christian Thieleman in rehearsal I found particularly insightful. The editing and structure crosses between these different aspects very skillfully. I gave it four stars and not five because I did find some of the interview statements over-the-top and flat out wrong, but, hey, I'm a Wagner fan and being opinionated comes with the territory...
